ResearchProjectDef.label: standard-issue weaponry
ResearchProjectDef.description: Standard issue weapons, the most common on the battlefield.

ResearchProjectDef.label: chain of command
ResearchProjectDef.description: Train officers and lead your soldiers to victory, morale and strategy are key to any battle.

ResearchProjectDef.label: first aid
ResearchProjectDef.description: Save your wounded soldiers and give them medical attention, live to fight another day.

ResearchProjectDef.label: winter operations
ResearchProjectDef.description: Warmer uniforms so your soldiers can survive even the coldest of weather.

ResearchProjectDef.label: summer operations
ResearchProjectDef.description: Lighter uniforms to protect your soldiers from the blazing heat of the deserts and tropical rainforests.

ResearchProjectDef.label: chemical warfare
ResearchProjectDef.description: Special equipment to protect your soldiers from the deadly toxic substances that threaten to poison your forces.

ResearchProjectDef.label: infantry hand grenades
ResearchProjectDef.description: Throwable explosives carried by infantry, these volatile weapons can cause the enemy a great deal of damage and quickly eliminate their infantry.

ResearchProjectDef.label: semi-automatic weaponry
ResearchProjectDef.description: Improved infantry weapons. These are much more versatile and efficient than typical standard-issue equipment but maintain very similar stats.

ResearchProjectDef.label: bayonets
ResearchProjectDef.description: Long blade attachments for certain weapons, frequently used in the close quarters combat of the trenches.

ResearchProjectDef.label: automatic weaponry
ResearchProjectDef.description: Automatic infantry weapons. These weapons are far less precise than the more common service rifles but can prove to be the difference between life and death in a fight.

ResearchProjectDef.label: light machine guns
ResearchProjectDef.description: The lightest of heavy weaponry, these brutes can wreak having on the battlefield and be key to winning a battle. Few other weapons hold the LMG's ability to defend points and suppress enemy positions.

ResearchProjectDef.label: sniper warfare
ResearchProjectDef.description: Rifles modified for long range usage, fighting your enemy from afar gives you the advantage and prevents the enemy from fighting you at full force.

ResearchProjectDef.label: anti-tank equipment
ResearchProjectDef.description: Heavy explosives meant to take down or disable armored targets, these special weapons can shred through your enemy's most armored soldiers and defenses.
